meanings.definition: The quality or state of being turgid or swollen.
meanings.sent1: The turgency of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent2: The turgency of the fruit indicated it was ripe.
meanings.sent3: The turgency of the marshmallow made it bounce when dropped.
meanings.sent4: The turgency of the river after the rain was like a bloated snake.
meanings.sent5: The turgency of the sponge soaked up all the water quickly.

meanings.definition: The degree of turgidness or swelling.
meanings.sent1: The turgency of the dough showed it was ready to bake.
meanings.sent2: The turgency of the plant's leaves suggested it needed more water.
meanings.sent3: The turgency of the balloon made it float effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The turgency of the cloud signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The turgency of the pillow made it extra fluffy and comfortable.

meanings.definition: The state of being distended or swollen.
meanings.sent1: The turgency of the tire indicated it needed more air.
meanings.sent2: The turgency of the balloon made it hard to pop.
meanings.sent3: The turgency of the bubble gum made it easy to blow a big bubble.
meanings.sent4: The turgency of the riverbank after the flood was alarming.
meanings.sent5: The turgency of the water balloon made it burst with a loud pop.
